headline.main: WARRANTS ISSUED FOR 875 SEAMEN; Germans and Italians Face Internment -- F.B.I. Starts Ship-Sabotage Inquiry WARRANTS ISSUED FOR 875 SEAMEN IT'S THUMBS UP FOR THESE DANISH SEAMEN

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 31 -- Warrants were issued by the Department of Justice today for the arrest of about 100 German and 775 Italian seamen who were removed from the two German and twenty-eight Italian vessels that were taken into protective custody by the Coast Guard in American ports over the week-end.
snippet: WASHINGTON, March 31 -- Warrants were issued by the Department of Justice today for the arrest of about 100 German and 775 Italian seamen who were removed from the two German and twenty-eight Italian vessels that were taken into protective custody...

byline.original: By BERTRAM HULENSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES
